title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kocsis, Á.T. 2023 via: Virtual Arrays R.
code: @Misc{,   title = {via: Virtual Arrays for R},   author = {Ádám T. Kocsis},   year = {2023}, }

title: Virtual Arrays for R
text: package defines base class VirtualArray, wrapper around lists allow users fold arbitrary sequential data n-dimensional, R-style virtual arrays. derived VirtualArray class defined used homogeneous lists contain single class objects. RasterArray SfArray classes enable use stacked spatial data instead lists. test site!!

title: Virtual Arrays for R
text: functions originally developed published part chronosphere R package. better compliance UNIX philosophy efficient distribution/development, original chronosphere broken three R packages: rgplates: functions related tectonic reconstructions. via: Virtual Arrays efficient organisation high-dimenional data. chronosphere: version-controlled data distribution. beta version, like R, comes absolutely warranty.

title: Array of SpatRasters — RasterArray-class
text: Array class easier navigation multilayer rasters

title: Array of SpatRasters — RasterArray-class
text: stack SpatRaster class object. index vector, matrix array type object. Includes either indices layers stack, names. dim numeric vector. array, creates proxy procedurally.

title: Array of SpatRasters — RasterArray-class
text: RasterArray-class object.

title: Array of SpatRasters — RasterArray-class
text: class implements structures organize single-layer SpatRasters dimensions. Subsetting rules defined using proxy object index slot. See examples implementations. class two slots: stack: SpatRaster object multiple layers, actual data. index: proxy object represents organization layers.

title: Array of SpatRasters — RasterArray-class
code: # example data   ex <- rastex()   st <-ex@stack   ind <- 1:6   names(ind) <- letters[1:length(ind)]   ra<- RasterArray(stack=st, index=ind)

title: Array of Sf-class data — SfArray-class
text: Array class easier navigation vector spatial datasets

title: Array of Sf-class data — SfArray-class
text: stack list sf-class objects. index vector, matrix array type object. Includes either indices layers stack, names. dim numeric vector. array, creates proxy procedurally.

title: Array of Sf-class data — SfArray-class
text: SfArray-class object.

title: Array of Sf-class data — SfArray-class
text: class implements structures organize entire Sf-objects share coordinate reference systesm. Subsetting rules defined using proxy object index slot. See examples implementations. class derived VirtualArray class. class two slots: stack: list object multiple sf layers, actual data. index: proxy object represents organization layers.

title: Array of Sf-class data — SfArray-class
code: # example data   library(sf)  #> Linking to GEOS 3.8.0, GDAL 3.0.4, PROJ 6.3.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE #>  #> Attaching package: ‘sf’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:via’: #>  #>     st_bbox, st_crs, st_transform   data(paleocoastlines)    st <-paleocoastlines@stack   ind <- 1:nlayers(st)   dim(ind) <- c(3,2)   dimnames(ind) <- list(age=c(0, 10, 20), c("margin", "coastlines"))   sa<- SfArray(stack=st, index=ind)

what: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
title: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: Double bracket '[[' refers elements'/layers' name @stack VirtualArray. Use single brackets extract elements based position VirtualArray.

title: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
code: # S4 method for VirtualArray,ANY,ANY [[(x, i, drop = TRUE)

title: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: x VirtualArray subscript first dimension(rows) vector-like subsetting. drop logical VirtualArray dropped element reduced element class?

title: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: VirtualArray-derived class object, object class makes VirtualArray

title: Indexing to extract the elements of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — [[,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
code: data(exemplar) # finds a layer exemplar[["sample1"]] #>     x          y #> 1   1 -43.659256 #> 14 14 -20.793723 #> 34 34 -25.883039 #> 39 39  -8.181445 #> 43 43 -19.785609 #> 51 51   7.698047 #> 59 59  -5.043689 #> 68 68  17.948349 #> 82 82  12.174447 #> 87 87  17.821889 # returns a stack exemplar[[c("sample1", "sample2")]] #> class         : XArray  #> Element properties:  #> - class       :  data.frame  #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 2  (vector) #> - num. layers : 2 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>  [1] "sample1" "sample2" #>  # replaces a layervalues, but not the attributes of the layer exemplar2 <- exemplar exemplar2[["sample1"]] <- exemplar2[["sample2"]] # compare every value in the they are all the same exemplar2[["sample1"]]$x == exemplar2[["sample2"]]$x #>  [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE #> [16] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE

what: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
title: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: Single bracket '[' refers indices names within VirtualArray . Use double brackets extract layers based names (stack).

title: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
code: # S4 method for VirtualArray,ANY,ANY [(x, i, j, ..., drop = TRUE)

title: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: x object VirtualArray-derived class. subscript first dimension(rows) vector-like subsetting. j subscript second dimension (columns). ... subscript additional dimensions. drop logical case result subsetting single element, VirtualArray-derived wrapper dropped?

title: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
text: object either class x class elements.

title: Indexing to extract subsets of a codeVirtualArray-class object — [,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY-method
code: ex <- rastex() # numeric subsetting firstThree <- ex[1:3] # character subsetting second <- ex["d"] # logical subsetting subscript <- rep(FALSE, length(ex)) subscript[2] <- TRUE second2 <- ex[subscript] data(paleocoastlines) present<- paleocoastlines["0", ] allMargin <- paleocoastlines[, "margin"]

what: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
title: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
text: Array template

title: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
text: stack list-class object. index vector, matrix array type object. Includes indices layers stack. dim numeric vector. array, creates proxy procedurally.

title: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
text: XArray-class object.

title: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
text: class implements structures organize objects class multidimensional arrays. Subsetting rules defined using proxy object index slot. See examples implementations. class two slots: stack: list containing objects class (.e. layers). index: proxy object represents structure entities.

title: Virtual Array of general R objects — XArray-class
code: # 2d XArray of vectors   data(exemplar)   st <-exemplar@stack   ind <- 1:nlayers(st)   dim(ind) <- c(3,4)   dimnames(ind) <- list(n = c(10, 20, 30), seed = 1:4)   xa<- XArray(stack=st, index=ind)

title: Number of columns and rows of a VirtualArray-derived class object. — ncol,VirtualArray-method

code: data(paleocoastlines) ncol(paleocoastlines) #> [1] 2 nrow(paleocoastlines) #> [1] 3

title: Number of elements or layers in a VirtualArray-derived class object — nlayers
text: length() function returns number elements present based array structure , total number values stored object. object can contain missing values, number actual layers can queried nlayers.

title: Number of elements or layers in a VirtualArray-derived class object — nlayers
code: ex <- rastex() # omit third element ex[3] <- NA # number of elements in the RasterArray length(ex) #> [1] 6 # remaining number values in the stack  length(ex@stack) #> [1] 1 # the number of remaining layers in the RasterArray nlayers(ex) #> [1] 5

title: Cropping — crop
code: ex <- rastex() # crop to a specific area if(requireNamespace("terra", quietly=TRUE)){  ext <- terra::ext(c(                    xmin = 106.58,    xmax = 157.82,    ymin = -45.23,    ymax = 1.14   ))   # cropping all   au<- crop(ex, ext) }

what: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
text: function restructures matrix extends current limits range defined names attribute

title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
code: newbounds(x, cols = NULL, rows = NULL)

title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
text: x matrix restructured. cols Column names guiding restructuring. rows Row names guiding restructuring.

title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
text: matrix extended bounds.

title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
text: essentially subsetting function allows subset even rownames colnames vector extends beyond bounds matrix traditional subsetting methods result notorious 'bounds' error.

title: Redefine bounds of a named matrix — newbounds
code: a<-matrix(1:9, ncol=3) rownames(a) <- c("a", "c", "d") newbounds(a, rows=letters[1:5]) #>   [,1] [,2] [,3] #> a    1    4    7 #> b   NA   NA   NA #> c    2    5    8 #> d    3    6    9 #> e   NA   NA   NA

code: rastex()

title: Procedural example structures to demonstrate the capabilities of the RasterArray-class — rastex
code: # create example example <- rastex()  # subset - single bracket example['b'] #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 180, 360, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1, 1  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : layer_2  #> min value   :       2  #> max value   :   64801   # subset - single bracket example[c(4, 6)] #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 2  (vector) #> - num. layers : 2 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>          d         f  #> "layer_4" "layer_6"  #>   # subset - double bracket example[["layer_2"]] #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 180, 360, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1, 1  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : layer_2  #> min value   :       2  #> max value   :   64801

what: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
title: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
text: Single bracket '[' refers indices names within \codeVirtualArray. Use double brackets replace layers based names (stack). Object types kind SpatRasters can used replace values RasterArrays. sf objects can used SfArrays.

title: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
code: # S4 method for VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical [(x, i, j, ...) <- value  # S4 method for RasterArray,ANY,ANY,SpatRaster [(x, i, j, ...) <- value  # S4 method for SfArray,ANY,ANY,sf [(x, i, j, ...) <- value

title: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
text: x VirtualArray-class object. subscript first dimension(rows) vector-like subsetting. j subscript second dimension (columns). ... subscript additional dimensions. value class object x.

title: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
text: None.

title: Replace layers of an object of a class derived from a VirtualArray. — [<-,VirtualArray,ANY,ANY,logical-method
code: ex <- rastex()  # replace third element with missing value ex[3] <- NA # duplicate first element and make it the second too ex[2] <- ex[1] ex #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 6  (vector) #> - num. layers : 5 #> - missing     : 1 #> - proxy: #>          a         b         c         d         e         f  #> "layer_1" "layer_1"        NA "layer_4" "layer_5" "layer_6"  #>

title: Resolution — xres
text: methods inherited RasterStack class, see res. Replacement allowed.

title: Resolution — xres
code: # S4 method for RasterArray xres(x)  # S4 method for RasterArray yres(x)  # S4 method for RasterArray res(x)

title: Resolution — xres
text: x RasterArray class object.

title: Resolution — xres
text: numeric vector.

title: Resolution — xres
code: ex <- rastex()  res(ex) #> [1] 1 1 yres(ex) #> [1] 1 xres(ex) #> [1] 1

title: Resampling — resample
code: ex <- rastex() if(requireNamespace("terra", quietly=TRUE)){   template <- terra::rast(res=5)   resampled <- resample(ex, template) }

code: data(paleocoastlines) moll<- st_transform(paleocoastlines, "ESRI:54009") #> Error in UseMethod("st_transform"): no applicable method for 'st_transform' applied to an object of class "c('SfArray', 'XArray', 'VirtualArray')" plot(moll["20", "margin"]$geometry, col="cyan") #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'plot': object 'moll' not found plot(moll["20", "coastline"]$geometry, add=TRUE, col="brown") #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'plot': object 'moll' not found

title: Subset a VirtualArray-class object — subset,VirtualArray-method
text: Extract subsets object class derived VirtualArray similarly regular array.

title: Subset a VirtualArray-class object — subset,VirtualArray-method
code: # S4 method for VirtualArray subset(x, i, j, ..., oneDim = FALSE, drop = TRUE)

title: Subset a VirtualArray-class object — subset,VirtualArray-method
text: x VirtualArray-class object. subscript first dimension(rows) vector-like subsetting. j subscript second dimension (columns). ... subscript additional dimensions. oneDim logical case multidimensional VirtualArrays, setting oneDim TRUE allows application one dimensional subscripts. drop logical case result subsetting single element, \codeVirtualArray wrapper dropped?

title: Subset a VirtualArray-class object — subset,VirtualArray-method
text: Either class x, class forms element VirtualArray.

title: Subset a VirtualArray-class object — subset,VirtualArray-method
code: ex <- rastex() # first 4 subset(ex, i=1:4) #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 4  (vector) #> - num. layers : 4 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>          a         b         c         d  #> "layer_1" "layer_2" "layer_3" "layer_4"  #>  # missing at the end subset(ex, i=1:12) #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 12  (vector) #> - num. layers : 6 #> - missing     : 6 #> - proxy: #>          a         b         c         d         e         f      <NA>      <NA>  #> "layer_1" "layer_2" "layer_3" "layer_4" "layer_5" "layer_6"        NA        NA  #>      <NA>      <NA>      <NA>      <NA>  #>        NA        NA        NA        NA  #>  # character subscript subset(ex, i=c("a", "b")) #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 2  (vector) #> - num. layers : 2 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>          a         b  #> "layer_1" "layer_2"  #>  # logical subscript subs <- rep(TRUE, length(ex)) subs[1] <- FALSE # remove first subset(ex, i= subs) #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 5  (vector) #> - num. layers : 5 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>          b         c         d         e         f  #> "layer_2" "layer_3" "layer_4" "layer_5" "layer_6"  #>  # no drop subset(ex, i=1, drop=FALSE) #> class         : RasterArray #> Element properties:  #> - class       : SpatRaster #> - dimensions  : 180, 360 (nrow, ncol) #> - resolution  : 1, 1 (x, y) #> - extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> - coord.ref.  : WGS 84 #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 1  (vector) #> - num. layers : 1 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>          a  #> "layer_1"  #>

text: x VirtualArray-class object.

title: Transpose a VirtualArray object — t,VirtualArray-method
text: VirtualArray-class object.

title: Transpose a VirtualArray object — t,VirtualArray-method
code: data(exemplar) t(exemplar) #> class         : XArray  #> Element properties:  #> - class       :  data.frame  #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 4, 3  (nrow, ncol) #> - num. layers : 12 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>      n #> seed 10         20         30         #>    1 "sample1"  "sample2"  "sample3"  #>    2 "sample4"  "sample5"  "sample6"  #>    3 "sample7"  "sample8"  "sample9"  #>    4 "sample10" "sample11" "sample12" #>  data(paleocoastlines) t(paleocoastlines) #> class         : SfArray  #> Element properties:  #> - class       :  sf data.frame  #> - geodetic CRS:  WGS 84  #> Array properties:  #> - dimensions  : 2, 3  (nrow, ncol) #> - num. layers : 6 #> - missing     : 0 #> - proxy: #>            0           10           20           #> margin    "0Ma_CM_v7" "10Ma_CM_v7" "20Ma_CM_v7" #> coastline "0Ma_CS_v7" "10Ma_CS_v7" "20Ma_CS_v7" #>

title: Virtual Arrays for R — via
text: base class VirtualArray defined, acts wrapper around lists allow users fold arbitrary sequential data n-dimensional, R-style virtual arrays. derived VirtualArray class defined used homogeneous lists contain single class objects. RasterArray SfArray classes enable use stacked spatial data instead lists.

title: Virtual Arrays for R — via
text: still Beta version. R, free software comes ABSOLUTELY WARRANTY. Nevertheless, notes found bugs suggestions welcome.

title: Virtual Arrays for R — via
text: Adam T. Kocsis (adam.t.kocsis@gmail.com)
